modules.description: Provides pretty-printers for error and write error types. Manages block device connections, reads and writes data in sector-aligned buffers, and retrieves device information. Supports asynchronous operations for disconnecting, reading, and writing to block devices.

Provides functions to control I/O buffering, open files with specified modes, retrieve file sizes, synchronize data to disk, and navigate data and hole regions within a file. Operates on file descriptors, file paths, and 64-bit offsets. Used to efficiently manage large files, ensure data integrity after writes, and optimize storage access patterns.

Provides asynchronous file operations such as reading, writing, and seeking, along with file metadata retrieval like size and modification time. Works with file descriptors, byte buffers, and timestamps. Used to manage disk I/O in event-driven applications, ensuring non-blocking data transfer and efficient resource handling.

Reads and writes VHD format data, including parsing headers, managing disk images, and handling sector-level data. Operates on byte arrays, file descriptors, and structured VHD metadata. Enables direct access to disk sectors for forensic analysis, virtual machine image conversion, and remote data streaming.

Manages block device and file I/O with asynchronous operations, including reading, writing, and metadata retrieval. Supports sector-aligned data transfers, file buffering, and large file handling using 64-bit offsets and file descriptors. Enables non-blocking disk access, error reporting, and data synchronization for efficient storage management. Examples include reading from a block device, seeking within a file, and retrieving file modification times.
